evals.prompt: Fix this broken test in src/utils/auth.test.ts
evals.expected_output: The model reads auth.ts and its consumers before editing, fixes the test, checks for similar breakage in related tests, and runs the test suite after making changes
expectations: Reads auth.ts (the module under test) before editing the test file
Uses Grep to find other files that import from auth.ts or auth.test.ts
Checks for existing test patterns in sibling test files
Runs the test suite (bun test, jest, vitest, etc.) after making changes
Reports what was fixed and confirms tests pass
Does NOT use 'as any' or type-unsafe workarounds to fix the test

evals.prompt: Port the image generation feature from /reference/canvas-app into this project
evals.expected_output: The model writes a complete plan listing all features to port, tracks each one, ports them all (or explicitly flags any it couldn't), verifies types, and runs checks
expectations: Writes a numbered plan of all features/files to port before starting
Reads the reference project structure to understand what exists
Does NOT silently drop any features from the plan
If a feature is blocked, explicitly says so with a reason
Verifies new packages are installed (checks package.json)
Verifies environment variables are documented or set up
Runs type checker after porting is complete
Final summary accounts for every item in the original plan

evals.prompt: Update the shared Button component to accept a new 'variant' prop
evals.expected_output: The model finds all Button consumers before making changes, ensures backwards compatibility, updates the component, and verifies no consumers break
expectations: Uses Grep to find every file that imports or uses the Button component
Reads at least 2-3 consumer files to understand current usage patterns
Makes the new prop optional (backwards compatible) or updates all consumers
Uses proper TypeScript types for the variant prop (not 'any' or 'string')
After changing the component, checks that consumers still compile
Runs type checker or linter after the change
Reports the list of consumers found and whether they need updates
